name: CJ
title: recommendation
tldr: I can confidently recommend Shay as a developer whose skills and understanding of technology extend far beyond her initial experience.
quote:
Shay joined our team with a solid foundation in web development and a genuine eagerness to learn. She has consistently exceeded my expectations, handling a diverse range of tasks independently and efficiently, often requiring minimal guidance. This versatility extends to her exceptional customer support and client relations skills. She consistently maintains professionalism while adeptly managing these interactions, showcasing her ability to multitask and excel across various responsibilities.

Shay's intelligence and diligence are evident not just in her approach to complex problems, but also in her ability to rapidly learn new technologies and continuously level up her existing skillset, like React. Despite needing to learn new areas on the fly, she consistently delivers tasks proficiently and on schedule.

She meets difficult challenges with perseverance and patience, and approaches roadblocks with self-awareness and open communication, always willing to seek clarification when necessary. This is further amplified by her collaborative spirit, making her a developer that thrives in a team environment.

I can confidently recommend Shay as a developer whose skills and understanding of technology extend far beyond her initial experience. Her quick grasp of new concepts and her ability to implement them effectively have been instrumental to our continued growth.

quote: Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. title: recommendation
tldr: Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old.
quote: Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Richard McClintock, a Latin professor at Hampden-Sydney College in Virginia, looked up one of the more obscure Latin words, consectetur, from a Lorem Ipsum passage, and going through the cites of the word in classical literature, discovered the undoubtable source. Lorem Ipsum comes from sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 of "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum" (The Extremes of Good and Evil) by Cicero, written in 45 BC. This book is a treatise on the theory of ethics, very popular during the Renaissance. The first line of Lorem Ipsum, "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet..", comes from a line in section 1.10.32.

title: recommendation
tldr: But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system...
quote: But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, which of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no annoying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure?

name: Anotha Persons
title: recommendation
tldr: On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire,...
quote: On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains
